TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AccessibleRole extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies values representing possible roles for an accessible object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The role of the object describes the function of the object and is used by accessibility applications.
This enumeration is used by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
For additional information about the accessibility application, search for "Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) library.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the creation of an accessibility-aware chart control, using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlAccessibleObject> classes to expose accessible information. The control plots two curves along with a legend. The `ChartControlAccessibleObject` class, which derives from `ControlAccessibleObject`, is used in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method to provide custom accessible information for the chart control. Because the chart legend is not an actual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> -based control, but instead is drawn by the chart control, it does not any built-in accessible information. Because of this, the `ChartControlAccessibleObject` class overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.GetChild%2A> method to return the `CurveLegendAccessibleObject` that represents accessible information for each part of the legend. When an accessible-aware application uses this control, the control can provide the necessary accessible information.
This example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> enumeration with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.Role%2A> property. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class overview for the complete code example.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject/CPP/chartcontrol.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject/CS/chartcontrol.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject/VB/chartcontrol.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Alert = int32(8)

Docs.summary: An alert or condition that you can notify a user about. Use this role only for objects that embody an alert but are not associated with another user interface element, such as a message box, graphic, text, or sound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Animation = int32(54)

Docs.summary: An animation control, which contains content that is changing over time, such as a control that displays a series of bitmap frames, like a filmstrip. Animation controls are usually displayed when files are being copied, or when some other time-consuming task is being performed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Application = int32(14)

Docs.summary: The main window for an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Border = int32(19)

Docs.summary: A window border. The entire border is represented by a single object, rather than by separate objects for each side.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ButtonDropDown = int32(56)

Docs.summary: A button that drops down a list of items.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ButtonDropDownGrid = int32(58)

Docs.summary: A button that drops down a grid.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ButtonMenu = int32(57)

Docs.summary: A button that drops down a menu.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Caret = int32(7)

Docs.summary: A caret, which is a flashing line, block, or bitmap that marks the location of the insertion point in a window's client area.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Cell = int32(29)

Docs.summary: A cell within a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Character = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A cartoon-like graphic object, such as Microsoft Office Assistant, which is typically displayed to provide help to users of an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Chart = int32(17)

Docs.summary: A graphical image used to represent data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole CheckButton = int32(44)

Docs.summary: A check box control, which is an option that can be turned on or off independent of other options.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Client = int32(10)

Docs.summary: A window's user area.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Clock = int32(61)

Docs.summary: A control that displays the time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Column = int32(27)

Docs.summary: A column of cells within a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ColumnHeader = int32(25)

Docs.summary: A column header, which provides a visual label for a column in a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ComboBox = int32(46)

Docs.summary: A combo box, which is an edit control with an associated list box that provides a set of predefined choices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Cursor = int32(6)

Docs.summary: A mouse pointer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Default = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: A system-provided role.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Diagram = int32(53)

Docs.summary: A graphical image used to diagram data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Dial = int32(49)

Docs.summary: A dial or knob. This can also be a read-only object, like a speedometer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Dialog = int32(18)

Docs.summary: A dialog box or message box.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Document = int32(15)

Docs.summary: A document window, which is always contained within an application window. This role applies only to multiple-document interface (MDI) windows and refers to an object that contains the MDI title bar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole DropList = int32(47)

Docs.summary: A drop-down list box. This control shows one item and allows the user to display and select another from a list of alternative choices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Equation = int32(55)

Docs.summary: A mathematical equation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Graphic = int32(40)

Docs.summary: A picture.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Grip = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A special mouse pointer, which allows a user to manipulate user interface elements such as a window. For example, a user can click and drag a sizing grip in the lower-right corner of a window to resize it.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Grouping = int32(20)

Docs.summary: The objects grouped in a logical manner. There can be a parent-child relationship between the grouping object and the objects it contains.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole HelpBalloon = int32(31)

Docs.summary: A Help display in the form of a ToolTip or Help balloon, which contains buttons and labels that users can click to open custom Help topics.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole HotkeyField = int32(50)

Docs.summary: A hot-key field that allows the user to enter a combination or sequence of keystrokes to be used as a hot key, which enables users to perform an action quickly. A hot-key control displays the keystrokes entered by the user and ensures that the user selects a valid key combination.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Indicator = int32(39)

Docs.summary: An indicator, such as a pointer graphic, that points to the current item.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole IpAddress = int32(63)

Docs.summary: A control designed for entering Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Link = int32(30)

Docs.summary: A link, which is a connection between a source document and a destination document. This object might look like text or a graphic, but it acts like a button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole List = int32(33)

Docs.summary: A list box, which allows the user to select one or more items.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ListItem = int32(34)

Docs.summary: An item in a list box or the list portion of a combo box, drop-down list box, or drop-down combo box.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole MenuBar = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A menu bar, usually beneath the title bar of a window, from which users can select menus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole MenuItem = int32(12)

Docs.summary: A menu item, which is an entry in a menu that a user can choose to carry out a command, select an option, or display another menu. Functionally, a menu item can be equivalent to a push button, radio button, check box, or menu.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole MenuPopup = int32(11)

Docs.summary: A menu, which presents a list of options from which the user can make a selection to perform an action. All menu types must have this role, including drop-down menus that are displayed by selection from a menu bar, and shortcut menus that are displayed when the right mouse button is clicked.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No role.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Outline = int32(35)

Docs.summary: An outline or tree structure, such as a tree view control, which displays a hierarchical list and usually allows the user to expand and collapse branches.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole OutlineButton = int32(64)

Docs.summary: A control that navigates like an outline item.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole OutlineItem = int32(36)

Docs.summary: An item in an outline or tree structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole PageTab = int32(37)

Docs.summary: A property page that allows a user to view the attributes for a page, such as the page's title, whether it is a home page, or whether the page has been modified. Normally, the only child of this control is a grouped object that contains the contents of the associated page.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole PageTabList = int32(60)

Docs.summary: A container of page tab controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Pane = int32(16)

Docs.summary: A separate area in a frame, a split document window, or a rectangular area of the status bar that can be used to display information. Users can navigate between panes and within the contents of the current pane, but cannot navigate between items in different panes. Thus, panes represent a level of grouping lower than frame windows or documents, but above individual controls. Typically, the user navigates between panes by pressing TAB, F6, or CTRL+TAB, depending on the context.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ProgressBar = int32(48)

Docs.summary: A progress bar, which indicates the progress of a lengthy operation by displaying colored lines inside a horizontal rectangle. The length of the lines in relation to the length of the rectangle corresponds to the percentage of the operation that is complete. This control does not take user input.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole PropertyPage = int32(38)

Docs.summary: A property page, which is a dialog box that controls the appearance and the behavior of an object, such as a file or resource. A property page's appearance differs according to its purpose.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole PushButton = int32(43)

Docs.summary: A push button control, which is a small rectangular control that a user can turn on or off. A push button, also known as a command button, has a raised appearance in its default off state and a sunken appearance when it is turned on.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole RadioButton = int32(45)

Docs.summary: An option button, also known as a radio button. All objects sharing a single parent that have this attribute are assumed to be part of a single mutually exclusive group. You can use grouped objects to divide option buttons into separate groups when necessary.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Row = int32(28)

Docs.summary: A row of cells within a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole RowHeader = int32(26)

Docs.summary: A row header, which provides a visual label for a table row.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ScrollBar = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A vertical or horizontal scroll bar, which can be either part of the client area or used in a control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Separator = int32(21)

Docs.summary: A space divided visually into two regions, such as a separator menu item or a separator dividing split panes within a window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Slider = int32(51)

Docs.summary: A control, sometimes called a trackbar, that enables a user to adjust a setting in given increments between minimum and maximum values by moving a slider. The volume controls in the Windows operating system are slider controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Sound = int32(5)

Docs.summary: A system sound, which is associated with various system events.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole SpinButton = int32(52)

Docs.summary: A spin box, also known as an up-down control, which contains a pair of arrow buttons. A user clicks the arrow buttons with a mouse to increment or decrement a value. A spin button control is most often used with a companion control, called a buddy window, where the current value is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole SplitButton = int32(62)

Docs.summary: A toolbar button that has a drop-down list icon directly adjacent to the button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole StaticText = int32(41)

Docs.summary: The read-only text, such as in a label, for other controls or instructions in a dialog box. Static text cannot be modified or selected.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole StatusBar = int32(23)

Docs.summary: A status bar, which is an area typically at the bottom of an application window that displays information about the current operation, state of the application, or selected object. The status bar can have multiple fields that display different kinds of information, such as an explanation of the currently selected menu command in the status bar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Table = int32(24)

Docs.summary: A table containing rows and columns of cells and, optionally, row headers and column headers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Text = int32(42)

Docs.summary: The selectable text that can be editable or read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole TitleBar = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A title or caption bar for a window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ToolBar = int32(22)

Docs.summary: A toolbar, which is a grouping of controls that provide easy access to frequently used features.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole ToolTip = int32(13)

Docs.summary: A tool tip, which is a small rectangular pop-up window that displays a brief description of the purpose of a button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole WhiteSpace = int32(59)

Docs.summary: A blank space between other objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Window = int32(9)

Docs.summary: A window frame, which usually contains child objects such as a title bar, client, and other objects typically contained in a window.
